text: The Mnet Asian Music Award for Best Band Performance (베스트 밴드 퍼포먼스) is an award presented annually by CJ E&M; Pictures (Mnet). It was first awarded at the 1st Mnet Asian Music Awards ceremony held in 1999; the band Jaurim won the award for their song "낙화", and it is given in honor for the band with the most artistic achievement in band performances in the music industry."1999 M.net Korean Music Festival Winners list". MAMA. Retrieved 2014-06-13. The category was originally named "Best Rock Performance" from 1999 to 2009. Since then, it has changed to "Best Band Performance". ==Winners and nominees== Jaurim, (1999, 2001) YB, (2002) Seo Taiji, (2000, 2004) Nell, (2008) Boohwal, (2009) Busker Busker, (2012-13) {| class="wikitable sortable" rowspan=2 style="text-align: center;" border="2" cellpadding="4" background: #f6e39c; |- style="background:#bebebe;" !scope="col" style="width:10%;"| Year !scope="col" style="width:25%;"| Winner(s) !scope="col" style="width:20%;"| Song !scope="col" style="width:25%;"| Nominee(s) |- !colspan=4|Best Rock Performance |- !scope="row" style="text-align:center" |1999 (1st) |Jaurim |"Fall (낙화)" |style="font-size: 85%;"| * Kim Jong-seo - "Broken Hearted" * Novasonic - "Empire of the Sun" * Deli Spice - "Running bicycle (달려라 자전거)" * Red Plus - "Please Come Again Someday" (언젠가한번꼭한번) |- !scope="row" style="text-align:center" |2000 (2nd) |Seo Taiji |"Ultramania" |style="font-size: 85%;"| * Kim Kyung-ho (김경호) - Island – "Summer Night's Dream" |- !2019 (21st) | Jannabi |"For Lovers who Hesitate" |style="font-size: 85%;"| * Day6 – "Time of Our Life" * M.C the MAX – "After you've Gone" * Nell – "Let's Part" * N.Flying – "Rooftop" |} Each year is linked to the article about the Mnet Asian Music Awards held that year. ==Multiple awards for Best Band Performance== As of 2015, six (6) artists received the title two or more times. {| class="wikitable" style="width:95%; text-align:center;" |- !width=40%|Artist(s)!!width=10%| Record Set!! style="width:30%;"|First year awarded!!width=30%|Recent year awarded |- |CNBLUE ||4 || 2011 || 2016 |- |Busker Busker ||rowspan=6|2 || 2012 || 2013 |- |Hyukoh || 2017 || 2018 |- |Buzz || 2005 || 2006 |- |Cherry Filter || 2003 || 2007 |- |Seo Taiji || 2000 || 2004 |- |Jaurim || 1999 || 2001 |} ==Notes== ==References== * * * ==External links== * Mnet Asian Music Awards official website Category:Mnet Asian Music Awards
